_comment: Resources are displayed ordered by type_order (1-99) or topic_order (1-99), and year. Thumbs are displayed only if order is under 5

topics.title: Getting Started
topics.descr: How can I get started with Capella?

topics.title: Business Value
topics.descr: What are the benefits of using Arcadia method and Capella tool?

topics.title: Discussing
topics.descr: Where can I interact with the Capella community?

topics.title: Learning More
topics.descr: What can I do with Capella?

topics.title: Add-ons
topics.descr: Which other tools can I integrate with Capella?

topics.title: Development
topics.descr: How to adapt Capella to my own enginnering process?

items.title: Powering Capella Champions: Enablers for Effective Model Authoring and Utilization
items.descr: This presentation explores key enablers for Capella champions to ensure the successful adoption and utilization of Capella within an organization.
items.author: Tony Komar (Siemens DISW)

items.title: Collaborative Model-Based Engineering and Large Systems Development
items.descr: This presentation reports on the collaborative Model-Based System Engineering (MBSE) approach followed for Galileo Second Generation using Team for Capella
items.author: Catherine Morlet (ESA), Alberto González Fernández (ESA)

items.title: Introducing MBSE in an Organization Successfully
items.descr: Apparently, introducing MBSE, Arcadia and Capella in an organization requires more than just the manual for Capella and reading Jean-Luc Voirin's great book on Arcadia. This presentation will share the experiences and the lessons we learned, that allowed us to (re)introduce MBSE in our organization successfully.
items.author: Erik Visser (Thales)

items.title: Model-Driven Design and Development of an Electromechanical Actuation System
items.descr: The implementation of a model-driven approach to the design and development of an electromechanical actuator conceived to control the aerodynamic surfaces of a conventional aircraft.
items.author: Elena García Llorente (CESA - Heroux Devtek), Luis Cárdenas González (Anzen)

items.title: Practice in COMAC to Conduct MBSA in Avionics System Based on Capella
items.descr: We introduce how we extend Capella in COMAC to support 4761-compliant MBSA work. It includes how to define failure conditions in Capella PA model, how to carry out failure propagation modeling on Capella function, behavioral physical component, and node physical component, how to automatically generate fault trees for failure conditions, and how to carry out safety analysis based on the calculation results of the minimum cut set of each fault tree, and so on
items.author: Wang Ran (COMAC), Yan Weizhen (PGM)

items.title: Capella for Modelling CubeSat: Tailored SE Process for Leveraging Model-Based Systems Engineering
items.descr: The goal of this presentation is to enable CubeSat developers seamlessly integrate SE practices along with MBSE into their existing workflows.
items.author: Suvigya Gupta, Dhirendra Singh, Stueti Gupta (BlueKei Solutions)

items.title: Enterprise Modelling for Lifecycle Engineering on the Example of Sustainability
items.descr: This talk explains – based on a comprehensive example on digital farming solutions – how System Engineering can be applied to understand causalities in Enterprise Systems and to come to meaningful strategic business decisions
items.author: Chantal Sinnwell, Michael Bitzer (Siemens DISW)

items.title: Capella MBSE Integration for Robotic Arm Development
items.descr: Redwire Space Europe trialled the Capella Model-Based Systems Engineering tool to capture higher level robotic needs, and task details and their relationship to lower level physical and functional models. Using Capella, we focused on formalizing Concept of Operations (ConOps) development for a robotics architecture that has a general physical architecture.
items.author: Vinayak Vadlamani (Redwire Space Europe)

items.title: Enhance the Efficiency of Systems Engineering with a Tailoring of SE Processes and ARCADIA Method
items.descr: The principle of the tailoring approach is to focus from 'generic' (coming from SE standards or general-purpose ARCADIA description or general-purpose usage of CAPELLA tool) down to a 'specific' (applicable by the project team for the objectives and the context of a real project).
items.author: Bruno Vuillemin (Capgemini Engineering)

items.title: In Pursuit of Robust Failure Mode Effects Analysis in the Design Phase
items.descr: In this presentation, we describe how we relate three different failure classes to failure effects by relying particularly on the information in Exchange Scenario diagrams and illustrate an example of implementing such an method using a common system model in Capella.
items.author: Steven Huang (ManTech), Alice Cellamare (p2m berlin)

items.title: Efficient and Comprehensive FMECAs: Harnessing the Power of MBSE Models in Capella
items.descr: Using a case study from the semiconductor equipment industry, this presentation describes a method of leveraging Capella MBSE models to streamline the generation of FMECAs. Utilizing Python4Capella, we automated the extraction of vital MBSE model objects and relationships, essential for generating an exhaustive FMECA, and seamlessly populated it into an MS Excel based FMECA template that is commonly used by the engineering community.
items.author: Sushim Koshti, Neela Ayalasomayajula (Applied Materials)

items.title: Lean Startup with Capella MBSE
items.descr: This presentation focuses on applying some of these Lean Startup techniques within Capella to effectively arrive at system architectures.
items.author: Brent Bailey (StarFish Medical)

items.title: A Model Based System Architecture Methodology Leveraging the ARCADIA Method
items.descr: Dr Dano presents a methodology based on ARCADIA. He explains how this methodology takes advantage of ARCADIA as a framework to determine which views constitute the architectural model, on alignment with the IEEE 15288:2015 architecture standard.
items.author: Dr. Eric Dano (George Washington University)

items.title: Digitally Assisted Design for Safety
items.author: Pablo López Negro (Anzen)

items.title: PdQSat: Aplicação MBSE em um projeto universitário
items.author: Bruna Queiroz & Maria Letícia Fraga (UFMG alumni)

items.author: David Hetherington & Pascal Roques

items.title: Capella Community Survey 2022, the Results
items.descr: A survey conducted among the Capella community to gain insights into the usage of the workbench and the expectations surrounding Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE).
items.author: Frédéric Madiot (Obeo)

items.title: Wikipedia - Arcadia (Ingenieurwesen)

items.author: Hans-Guenter Thonemann

items.title: Assess the environmental impacts of your system architecture
items.descr: Performing a life cycle assessment (LCA) can help you precisely identify the types of impacts a system has, from the extraction of raw materials to its end-of-life phase. However, this is often a tedious process that involves inputting the system architecture into an LCA tool and mapping it to environmental databases. This makes it difficult to repeat the process multiple times for the same system. So why not reuse your Capella models to conduct LCAs?
items.author: Arnaud Dieumegard (Obeo)

items.title: Cybersecurity Assets & Threats Modeling with Capella
items.descr: Discover Darc, a new Capella add-on that enables systems engineers to address cybersecurity concerns while defining system architectures: identify assets and trust boundaries, identify threats, characterize security needs.
items.author: Juan Navas & Sophie Plazanet (Thales)

items.title: Company-wide Architecting Assets to Inform Design Decisions
items.descr: A case-study by Thermo Fisher Scientific, a global company with 110,000 employees that supplies scientific instrumentation.
items.author: Thermo Fisher Scientific

items.title: From Document-Driven to Digital-Native Engineering
items.descr: A case-study by Naval Group, a leading international player in the field of naval defense.
items.author: Naval Group

items.title: The Transformation of a Complex Air Traffic Management System
items.descr: A case-study by Thales Australia about OneSKY, the new Australia-wide integrated Civil and Military Air Traffic Management System, known as CMATS

items.title: Conceptual Design of the STEP Fusion Power Plant
items.descr: A case-study by UK Atomic Energy Authority about STEP (Spherical Tokamak for Energy Production), a project aiming to deliver a UK fusion energy plant prototype.

items.title: IEEE Syscon - Not (strictly) relying on SysML for MBSE: language, tooling and development perspectives
items.descr: Using the Arcadia/Capella solution as an example, this paper explores why standard UML/SysML languages are not necessarily the unique or best alternatives for implementation of a model-based systems engineering solution (MBSE).

items.title: Arcadia and Capella for a large complex mechanical system
items.descr:
Rolls-Royce used Arcadia/Capella to define the architecture of a large civil aerospace turbofan engine, to manage system complexity and minimise the associated risk.
